SENT.plain: Pulmonary arterial and intracranial calcifications are rarely found in children
A female infant, the recipient of a twin-twin transfusion syndrome was found, by ultrasound and computed tomography, to have both pulmonary arterial and intracerebral calcification
A rare condition, termed idiopathic arterial calcification of infancy, is the likely cause
This condition carries a poor prognosis and is usually fatal
